sn12.47:1.2: Then the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him. Seated to one side he said to the Buddha:
sn12.47:2.2: “‘All exists’: this is one extreme, brahmin.”
sn12.47:3.2: “‘All doesn’t exist’: this is the second extreme.
sn12.47:3.3: Avoiding these two extremes, the Realized One teaches by the middle way:
sn12.47:3.5: Choices are a condition for consciousness. …
sn12.47:3.6: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.47:3.7: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease.
sn12.47:3.9: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.’”
sn12.47:4.1: When he said this, the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi said to the Buddha,
sn12.47:4.3: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
